title: U.S. Futures, European Stocks Edge Lower Ahead of Fed Rate Decision | Morningstar
text: U.S. Futures, European Stocks Edge Lower Ahead of Fed Rate Decision U.S. futures for the S&P 500 were down 0.3% and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 0.4%. Changes in futures do not necessarily predict movements after the opening bell. In Europe, the Stoxx Europe 600 declined 0.5% in morning trading. Worldline added 2.1% and Billerud rose 2%. On the other hand, Bunzl lost 5%, and Ubisoft Entertainment dropped 3%. The FTSE 100 lost 0.6%. Other stocks in Europe were down as France's CAC 40 decreased 0.3% and Germany's DAX fell 0.1%. The Wall Street Journal Dollar Index climbed 0.1% to 101.31. In commodities, Brent crude dropped 0.3% to $73.67 a barrel, and WTI crude dropped 0.5% to $70.38 a barrel. The European benchmark price for natural gas, the Dutch futures contract TTF, was down 0.7% to 40.02 euros a megawatt hour. The German 10-year Bund yield was flat at 2.251%, and the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury climbed by 2 basis points to 4.423% from 4.405%. Bond prices and yields move in opposite directions. Stocks in Asia were down as Japan's Nikkei 225 index dropped 0.2%, and Hong Kong's Hang Seng dropped 0.5%. China's benchmark Shanghai Composite declined 0.7%. -This article was automatically generated by MarketWatch. Write to Barcelona Editors at barcelonaeditors@dowjones.com (END) Dow Jones Newswires December 17, 2024 03:53 ET (08:53 GMT) Copyright (c) 2024 Dow Jones & Company, Inc.
